text: Nicola Zanon is a Thai of Italian descent alpine skier who competed for Thailand at the 2018 Winter Olympics. ==Background== Zanon was born in 14 December 1996 to an Italian father and a Thai mother and grew up in Val di Rabbi in Trentino. He started skiing at age 8 at the Madonna di Campiglio. He previously attempted to qualify for the 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi, Russia but failed leading to his retirement and worked as a woodworker with his father. However he came out of retirement when the Ski and Snowboard Association of Thailand on February 2017 offered him a chance to compete at the 2018 Winter Olympics for the Southeast Asian nation. He participated in races in Argentina, Chile, and Italy to qualify for the Olympics. Before his participation in the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea, he trained at the Piste Azzurre in Val di Fassa under coach Stefano Vampa. In the men's giant slalom event held in 18 February he did not finish in the first run. ==References== Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:People from Trentino Category:Thai people of Italian descent Category:Italian people of Thai descent Category:Thai male alpine skiers Category:Olympic alpine skiers of Thailand Category:Alpine skiers at the 2018 Winter Olympics
title: Nicola Zanon
